citations.narrative:
* Several dog doors in the Main Shelter Kennel had metal hinges. The surfaces for most of the metal hinges were
excessively rusty and or corroding. This can prevent require cleaning and sanitation and or affect the structural strength of
the surfaces. As result, disease hazards can increase and or the potential for an broken dog door hinge from corrosion
that could injure the 20 adult dogs house in these enclosures.
For the prevention of required cleaning and sanitation and to minimize structural deterioration, all surfaces must be kept
free of rust.
This is a (1st) Re-License Inspection for a Class “A" license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within (2) more inspection(s) or by (11-August-2024) or the applicant will forfeit the
license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License
Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.1(c)(1)(i) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
* Several dog doors in the Main Shelter Kennel had metal hinges. The surfaces for most of the metal hinges were 
excessively rusty and or corroding. This can prevent require cleaning and sanitation and or affect the structural strength of 
the surfaces. As result, disease hazards can increase and or the potential for an broken dog door hinge from corrosion 
that could injure the 20 adult dogs house in these enclosures.  
For the prevention of required cleaning and sanitation and to minimize structural deterioration, all surfaces must be kept 
free of rust. 
 
This is a (1st) Re-License Inspection for a Class “A" license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within (2) more inspection(s) or by (11-August-2024) or the applicant will forfeit the 
license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License 
Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
